Pre-Game Insights: Bhutan are currently placed in the tally’s third spot, winning and losing a game each in their two matches so far.
Indonesia are enduring a poor run of form in the tournament, with two successive defeats in the two matches they have played.
Bhutan will eye moving to the second spot, surpassing Maldives (MLD) with a win in this game against Indonesia (INA).
Indonesia will aim to win this game and get off the mark in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicket of the Gelephu International Cricket Ground is a bowling-friendly deck, especially in the initial phase of the game.
The average score here has been 116 runs, so the toss-winning skipper will look ahead to bowl first to restrict the opponent to a low total.
Others: Suprit Pradhan has scored 52 runs in two innings, with a decent average of 26.00, including the highest score of ’27 runs in a match.
Ferdinando Banunaek has scalped 2 wickets in two innings with a brilliant economy rate of 4.80.
Gakul Ghalley has scored 10 runs in two innings with a dismal batting average of 5.00 and a miserable strike rate of 52.00.
Ketut Ediguna Artawan has scalped only 1 wicket in two innings with a horrific bowling strike rate of 39.00.
